alert.note: Alert for Crowley County; Eastern Kiowa County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County; Lamar Vicinity, Prowers County; Las Animas Vicinity, Bent County; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Trinidad Vicinity, Western Las Animas County Below 7500 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Western Kiowa County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:28PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Multiple developing strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Otero, northern Prowers, northeastern Huerfano, Kiowa, northwestern Las Animas, Crowley, southeastern Pueblo and northern Bent Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Las Animas, or 21 miles northeast of North La Junta, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lamar, La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Las Animas, Fowler, Ordway, Swink, Eads, Manzanola, Wiley, Olney Springs, Sugar City, Cheraw, Crowley, Sheridan Lake, Haswell, Neeoshe Reservoir, Chivington and Blue Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.
